oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Founding Father, Henry Allen Boyd
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henry Allen Boyd Was Editor of Nashville Globe Newspaper From 1905-1959. Napier and Boyd Successfully Helped to Persuade the State to Build the Negro State Normal School in Davidson County. A Member of the Nashville's Negro Board of Trade, Boyd Appeared Before Numerous Legislative Sessions Until Black Nashville Received Support of the Governor and Mayor to Build the School.
